title: What Drives Aggressiveness of Smoker Lung Adenocarcinoma? Potential Role of Nicotine-Responsive Neuropeptides Neurotensin and Calcitonin-Related Polypeptide Alpha.
abstract: Lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD) is the most prevalent subtype of nonsmall cell lung cancer. Cigarette smoking, the primary etiological factor, introduces mutagenic and epigenetic changes that promote tumorigenesis, with nicotine acting as a key bioactive component modulating cellular signaling rather than directly causing mutations. In this study, differential transcriptomic profiling of smoker and nonsmoker LUAD samples from the PanCancer Atlas identified neurotensin (
